intro: Solanum austrocaledonicum, commonly known as the New Caledonia nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as tomatoes and potatoes. The plant typically grows as a shrub with hairy stems and small, oval-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually white or violet, with five petals, and it produces small, round berries that contain the seeds. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
